events.title: Giordano Bruno Executed
events.description: Italian philosopher Giordano Bruno was burned at the stake in Rome for heresy, including his support for the Copernican system and ideas about infinity and the universe.
events.significance: Bruno's execution marked a significant moment in the conflict between emerging scientific ideas and established religious doctrines.

events.title: The Second Schleswig War begins
events.description: Prussia and Austria declared war against Denmark over the control of the duchies of Schleswig and Holstein, starting the Second Schleswig War.
events.significance: This conflict reshaped the balance of power in Europe and contributed to German unification.

events.title: The Reichstag Fire occurs in Germany
events.description: The German parliament building in Berlin was set on fire, which the Nazis used as a pretext to arrest political opponents and consolidate power.
events.significance: The event allowed Adolf Hitler to push through emergency laws that led to the establishment of a totalitarian regime.

events.title: The Volkswagen Beetle becomes the most produced car
events.description: Volkswagen announced that the production of the Beetle had surpassed the one million milestone, making it the most produced car in history at that time.
events.significance: The Beetle became an iconic vehicle symbolizing affordability and reliability worldwide.

events.title: Kosovo declares independence from Serbia
events.description: Kosovo's parliament unilaterally declared independence, leading to widespread international debate and recognition issues.
events.significance: This declaration was a pivotal moment in Balkan politics and impacted international relations and sovereignty debates.
